content: have noticed there s quite many stitches on needle 2 now you can now move the side ribbing stitches to needle 1 just pull the cable through where the two markers not bor marker are and ta-dah stitches are rearranged remove bor marker and knit to end of needle 2 here s your new bor 44 sts on needle 1 and 28 sts on needle 2 from now on we will be making decreases on needle 1 according to chart b and increases on needle 2 to compensate the stitch count chart b + increases row 17 and all odd row needle 1 *k2 p2* 3 times k1 knit chart b k1 *p2 k2* 3 times needle 2 knit row 18 and all even row needle 1 *k2 p2* 3 times k1 knit chart b k1 *p2 k2* 3 times needle 2 m1 k to end of needle m1 continue until chart b is complete 28 sts on needle 1 44 sts on needle 2 chart b chart c needle 1 knit chart c needle 2 knit please note that increases are now made on needle 1 instead of needle 2 if you d like to have snugger socks you may omit some increases at the end of chart c chart c after finishing chart c knit in stockinette until the sock measures about 4 cm 1 5 in less than desired toe slip 4 stitches from needle 2 to needle 1 at both sides 36 sts on both needles if you omitted increases in last step just make sure to divide stitches in half keeping braid pattern in the middle of the instep row 1 *k1 ssk k to last 3 sts of the needle k2tog k1* repeat on needle 2 row 2 knit repeat row 1-2 four times more repeat row 1 until you ve reached the tip of your toe graft stitches using kitchener stitch finishing weave in ends and block wear with proud symbols
